p: With regards to leveraging the insights, research, and testimony of public health experts in climate litigation, it is worth noting the possibility of COVID-19 having opened a policy window for such action. Undoubtedly, COVID-19 has raised the profile of public health expertise and the value of epidemiology. Thus, public health expertise may be accorded rightful recognition in courts of law in a post-COVID-19 era, something which can and should be exploited in upcoming climate litigation.
